75 Let me subjoin a "pregnant instance", <s>of</s> which shall prove the importance of each
of the foregoing principles, <s>drawn</s> from the result of the<s>ir</s> violation
or neglect of it:- (1) So long as external conformation was alone regarded, and no
account was taken of <u>internal organisation</u>, the Nautiloid
Foraminifera were placed among Cephalopods, and the Coralloid
forms among Polypifera; to neither of which class have they any
kind of relationship; (2) So long as developmental <u>history</u> was
unstudied, the Hydroid Zoophytes and the Medusoid
Acalepha were considered as entirely disconnected groups, belonging
to two different Zoological classes; instead of (as in reality) different
states of the very same organism; (3) So long as reliance is placed
on the comparison of a <u>few individual specimens</u> only, without any
account being taken of the intermediate forms by which the more
